channel.title: Data smoothing
channel.description:
I have a set of values which appear to increase exponentially, but it's difficult to do any calculations using the data because it doesn't produce a smooth graph curve.
The nature of the data is supposed to be slightly erratic, but I need to find a trend so need to make my data 'smooth'.
If you're not sure what I'm trying to say, paste this data into a spreadsheet and make a line graph: [code] 1.87 4.56 8.36 9.53 10.64 11.91 17.68 20.01 21.35 29.86 39.91 42.09 43.90 48.23 59.11 64.37 74.86 [/code] You will notice that the values do not produce a nice smooth curve.

item.title: Data smoothing
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I think I need to do polynomial interpolation? Or would that just involve using my current values to process new function inputs? Wikipedia really sucks at teaching maths, especially morons like me who have only done GCSE.

Read full topic

item.title: Data smoothing
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I have a set of values which appear to increase exponentially, but it’s difficult to do any calculations using the data because it doesn’t produce a smooth graph curve.

The nature of the data is supposed to be slightly erratic, but I need to find a trend so need to make my data ‘smooth’.

If you’re not sure what I’m trying to say, paste this data into a spreadsheet and make a line graph:

1.87
4.56
8.36
9.53
10.64
11.91
17.68
20.01
21.35
29.86
39.91
42.09
43.90
48.23

64.37
74.86

You will notice that the values do not produce a nice smooth curve.
